724498f-a.text:
Houston Street, south side, west from West Broadway (formerly South Fifth Avenue). All the buildings shown on the south side of the street are shortly to be razed to facilitate subway construction.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
According to the New Eork Times of April 4, 1938 the City of New York, Department of Markets will erect a 1-story structure to be used as a Municipal Market on the site of buildings shown on the left and which will extend 1 block, from West Broadway, to Thompson Street; the site to include Nos. 89 to 105 West Houston Street and 160
Thompson Street.

724497f-b.text:
West Houston Street, north side, at West Broadway, showing both the N.E. (in Nos. 2 & 3) and N.W. (No. 1) corners. The buildings in the latter view bear No's 88 to 92 (from right to left). The elevated system seen on West Broadway is the Sixth Ave. line. No. 3 of this set is eastward from the corner shown in View No. 2 (N.E.).
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
724497f-b.folder: Houston Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724412f-a.text:
(A7 West Broadway, north across West Houston Street, showing the iron pillars of the Sixth Avenue "E1' still standing at the curb. To the left and right respectively are buildings at the N.W. and N.E. corners. In the distant background appears the Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. tower. View 2 is limited to show the west side of this thoroughfare several months later. Note the absence of the iron support seen in earlier view. To the left here are four Houston Street structures bearing No's. 88 to 94, beginning with the corner. This building extending 98 feet on West Broadway, carries there, No's 490-94.
View 1: March 19, 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(5S
West Broadway, west side, and N.W. corner of West Houston
Street looking northwards.
P. L. Sperr  April 30, 1940

724413f-a.text:
West Broadway, south from West Houston Street, showing individual photos of both sides of this thoroughfare during and subsecuent to the "El" demolition. The cleared areas in the foreground are part of the ewath sliced off of Houston Street for the Municipal Eighth Avenue Subway construction..
View 1: April 5, 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724413f-a.folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

724418f-a.text:
West Broadway, west side, south from and across Bleecker Street, showing this thoroughfare subsecuent to the demolition of the old Sixth Avenue "El" and its Bleecker Street station. At the right is a curved iron front structure that bears No's. 142 Bleecker Street and 510-16 West Broadway. This is at the S.W. corner of this intersection.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NAcg : O 72
